reviews.review_msg: Loved this class, seems like a lot of reading but honestly it's not bad at all. For the papers focus on a clear thesis, that's how you'll get a good mark. Papers and content is very interesting... Great prof & class!

He is very passionate about the topics he choses for these classes and loves to engage in conversation about these topics, however the overall Canvas design is very messy and there are very little details for his expectations on assignments. Funny, engaging prof, reading was not absolutely crucial but should be done. Would take again.

I'm a bit biased because I enjoyed the course. Feel like it's a bit unfair to expect first year students to write two assigns at about 14 double spaced pages in a first year course. The 1st assign (of 4) in the course I hated SO MUCH but the course I ended up really enjoying! Too bad we couldn't pick the topics to write about either.

He is arrogant and dismissing, gets out of patient easily. Do not attempt to ask him questions before thinking through the question first yourself. However, he is very useful and he's a very good lecturer. Exams are fair and the course is fun in general. The textbook is actually fun to read but make sure you get the latest edition.
Took this online. 4 paper + online discussion  100% of course grade. Tons of readings and its very confusing. NEVER TAKE IT ONLINE.

Consisted of one 2,500 word paper (20%), one 3,500 word paper (30%), and one assignment split into two separate papers: one 1,500 words, the other 2,500 words (together  30%). Also need to complete a 10 minute presentation (15%) and participate during other people's presentations (5%). Overall pretty easy, interesting topics, but LOTS of readings
Quite a bit of readings, midterm and final are all essay questions. Prof has no lec notes but I would recommend taking a class with him. Overall the class wasnt too difficult.

The textbook that he wrote was actually semi-interesting but the way he books it out of his class the second it's time and is just generally dismissive is so irritating. There are no notes during class and the amount of readings we have to do is absolutely ridiculous.

I took this class via distance ed. There is a lot of emphasis on interpretation of the readings and case studies, rather than straight memorization. No midterm or final for this course, just 4 term papers so there is a lot of reading/writing.

Took this by distance.  Course is superbly organized. Quite a few papers, but they are really clear. No exams. Easy GPA boost. Neil Boyd had no contact with the students in this class, but TM was great. Textbooks are expensive and are only required for assignments. You literally don't need to do any readings.
Don't take it with him, he does not have lecture notes ,and often jump from to topic to another. expect too much for student , too much reading ,but only few will be test on.

Good teacher for intel. students who can follow what he says as it requires insight/analysis. He is very informative on the subject, knows what he is talking about. Wrote the textbook for the class, which compliments the course perfectly. Its an interesting read that goes hand in hand with the lecture. Finding him hard means univ. isn't for you.

Was arrogant and dismissive. Actually had the nerve to sit back in his chair ( leaning) with his feet up while addressing the class. Made the class by a novel that wasn't even used. He prefers people who agree with him.

Informative class. Unfortunately the required textbooks were expensive and useless. The discussion during class was engaging. Yet, the topic often go off and the class was pretty much without any structure. Boyd seems to be helpful when you e-mail him or  during office hour. Boyd sounds friendly, but he is not afraid to be dismissive of your ideas.

I think he's really nice and the topics we discuss in class are interesting.  I dont find the class boring at all, I felt like I have learned a lot.  I asked him for help for my paper and he gave good advice.  He also responded to emails quickly.  The only negative thing that I can say is that we did not use 2/3 books required for this course

His lectures are so completely off-topic and full of BS that it makes his class irritating. Sure he's easy and all but god is this class a drag. If you get Michelle Funk as your TA, damn shes sexy but she marks so random and difficult and has no valid justification when you confront her. Overall not difficult, just extremely boring.

Took Via Distance Ed.  I dont know about the prof as I have not met him but avoid this class if your TA is Brittany Boyer!! She is extremly picky and does not hesitant to fail your essay regardless of your other marks

He truly is an arrogant professor. It's funny after reading the comments on here in my first few days of class, I didn't really agree with them until after a month. You realize he talks down to you and is dismissive of your ideas. He is a smart guy but I think he tries to show off sometimes with people he knows or books he has written...
Doesn't demonstrate a strong example students interested in having a positive experience with their professors.

This is the fist class I took by distance and it was easy. You MUST stay ontop of your readings and there are lots of them. I have no idea what Boyd did for distance. I emailed him once and never got a responce at all. The TM in this class - by far the worst I ever had. Brittney Boyer. Avoid her like the plague

He has no respect for his students and does not hesitate to talk down to u. He is arrogant and is the worst professor Ive had at SFU. He is no teacher, he is only a lawyer. He's obviously too comfortable with his associate director position and takes advantage of it. A complete waste of money. Needs to realize that he works for us We are paying him

I took this class by distance ed...so I didn't get to meet the prof. I think it was an extremely interesting class eventhough the readings did get long and boring sometimes. We had 3 papers and online participation which was good and no final!! Boyd sounds like a good prof...the TA for this course was good..I think that this course is easier by dis
Great teacher, wealth of invaluable knowledge

Yes, he doesn't seem to care about students, but do you really blame him? His seminars are really good- I think he can teach very well. My only complaint is custom courseware/books he makes us buy- expensive- we don't use it- and i think the authors are crap. His own books are much better, but I guess he wants to appear modest. Why bother?

Boyd is not at SFU to teach. He plugs away at his Blackberry during office hours, has vague criteria, and moved the final deadline up (on short notice) so he could leave for holidays early. Liberal viewpoints, which wouldn't be problematic if he weren't so hard-headed about them. If you already know a lot about drug policy,his seminars may bore you
Smart guy. Great lawyer. Bad prof. Arrogant as all hell. But not a whole lot of work is required for his classes. Say what he wants to hear and you should be fine.

this guy thinks hes all that cuz he gets interviewed in the province, always looks dishevelled like he just got off a plane from mexico, lots of talk but no even partly clear answer from boyd, makes you buy a bunch of books he wrote or is referenced to but you dont even use them so I felt really scammed spending all that money for nothingSTAY AWAY

A very skilled speaker.  Great insight on the David Milgaard case.  A lot of overlap between his text and lectures, but that just drills into your head the info, and reduces amount of time needed to study.  Good class-good prof.
No Comments
Best prof ever! very interesting, no notes, open book midterm, take home final....does it get any better then this??!?!?
great prof - seminar class at HC was excellent. Oral presentation, no final - gotta love that. Very relaxed atmosphere, down to earth prof.
boring lectures. just read the text. he shouts cuz he doesn't use a mic. MT was hard but Final was 2 take-home essays so that was a good mark booster. interesting if you like cdn law.
Good guy, but teaches it like a 3rd year course, not an intro, watch out rookies :)

Neil is awesome.  He runs the class in such a relaxed style.  While he never gave us a syllabus, made it evident that it didn't matter.  Take time to talk to him about you paper. So knowledgeable and helpful
Take PHIL 001 or 120 beforehand.  He marks based on your ability to form your own thoughts and argue for them coherently.  This is not a high school course where all you do is lit reviews, kids.
Really interesting professor- I really liked his class. It's hard but we're in university for god's sake... it's not supposed to be easy!
Come on, this is the guy who wrote an entire book dedicated to the decriminalization of marijuana, he obviously rules.  Take biological explantions of crim behavior if avaialble.
uses his hands too much when he talks ... is very self-involved and unhelpful
Excellent professor
course text doesn't correspond to speaker's list - gotta ask why???&
incredibly lazy, never available, egotistical
Interesting leactures, but his leactures and text don't help to get a good grade
Lawyers do like to hear themselves talk--Very boring, most unfair marker
self-indulgent; lazy, lazy, lazy & unfair
No Comments
